questions.question: She was booked for driving at ………………………  110 miles per hour.
questions.description: We use over, not above, to talk about ages and speeds.

questions.question: He is ……………………… on his uncle for his educational expenses.
You can eat ………………………… in my restaurant whenever you want.
questions.description: The adverb free means without payment freely means without restriction.

questions.question: Under no circumstances  ............................  in the bar.
questions.description: When the clause begins with a negative expression, we use an inverted word order.

questions.question: Britain ................................... as a land of law and order.
questions.description: We need a passive verb here.

questions.question: He wrote his first book after ............................. from Africa.
questions.description: It should be returning or he returned.

questions.question: I expected to fail the exam, but I passed ................................
questions.description: After all means 'contrary to what was expected'.

questions.question: When I was ................................ I was working.
questions.description: When I was your age (the structure is/are/was + … age is used without a preposition)

questions.question: All Indian ............................... suffered from white settlement in America.
questions.description: We use a plural noun after all.

questions.question: We do not allow people ................................. in the kitchen.
questions.description: Allow is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: Alice is not free on the 15th.  We will have to find an ................................. date for the meeting.
Her feet were sore because her shoes .............................. badly.
